paper_title: On inequalities involving counts of the prime factors of an odd perfect number
abstract: Let $N$ be an odd perfect number. Let $ω(N)$ be the number of distinct prime factors of $N$ and let $Ω(N)$ be the total number (counting multiplicity) of prime factors of $N$. We prove that $\frac{99}{37}ω(N) - \frac{187}{37} \leq Ω(N)$ and that if $3\nmid N$, then $\frac{51}{19}ω(N)-\frac{46}{19} \leq Ω(N)$.
